title: The Waste Land (version 3)
creator: T. S. Eliot
description: LibriVox recording of The Waste Land by T. S. Eliot. Read by Elizabeth Klett. The Waste Land is T. S. Eliot's Modernist masterpiece, first published in 1920. Rich in allusions to Shakespeare, Dante, Baudelaire, the Bible, Marvell, Buddha, and the folklore of the Holy Grail, among other sources, the poem emphasizes the fundamental fragmentation and lack of connection that characterizes modern life and relationships. (Summary by Elizabeth Klett) For more free audio books, or to become a volunteer reader, please visit LibriVox.org. M4B Grab Bag 05
subject: librivox; audio; poetry; eliot
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
